column4: hi, can you help me? Ubuntu 10.04, Belkin router N+ F5D8235-4. Linux cannot obtain IP adress. Windows works. Linux not. Where should i find solution?
hi, can you help me? Ubuntu 10.04, Belkin router N+ F5D8235-4. Linux cannot obtain IP adress. Windows works. Linux not. Where should i find solution?  PLEASE
is the card supported under linux ?
yes it is
how do you know ?
Because the last time it have been worked...after router reboot it stop to work
this is a wireless card ?
yes it is
I assume so with the N+ comment
ok, look if it's associated with the router
and?
ok, look if it's associated with the router
what do you mean please?
look if the card has associated it's self with the ESSID of the router
yes it is. sorry
can the route see the machine ?
yes,
does the wireless card have an IP address ?
no
is the syslog do you see DCHPOFFER a lot ?
and now i dont understand what do you mean
have you restarted your machine since restarting the router
yes, many times
what is the device name of your wireless card in linux /
